column2: saves long URLs as short handles as to not type them out each time
communicates with a remote repository and "fetches" down all the information that is in that repository that is not in the current one and stores it in the local database
a combination of 'git fetch' and 'git merge' where git will fetch from the remote and then merge it into the current branch
used to show all documentation in git about any command
takes a directory and turns it into a new git repository
shows the states of files in the working directory and staging area
used to see differences between any two trees
takes all file contents that have been staged and records a permanent snapshot in the database
